STATE OF MICHIGAN
DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES
GRETCHEN WHITMER ROBERT GORDON
LANSING
GOVERNOR DIRECTOR
May 6, 2020
Timothy Click
Barry County DHHS
430 Barfield Drive
Hastings, MI 49058
RE: License #: CP080200963
Barry County DHHS
430 Barfield Drive
Hastings, MI 49058
Dear Mr. Click:
Attached is the Renewal Inspection Report for the above referenced facility completed on
4/20/2020 - 4/23/2020 Due to the violations, a written corrective action plan is required. It
should be noted that violations of any licensing statutes rules and are also violations of
the ISEP and your contract. The corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of
this letter and must include the following:
 How compliance with each citation will be achieved.
 Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
licensing statute and rule or section of the contract or ISEP citation.
 Specific time frames for each citation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
 How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
 The signature of the responsible party and a date.
Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, a regular certificate of approval
license will be issued. If you fail to submit an acceptable corrective action plan,
disciplinary action will result.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager at (616)552-3662.
P.O. BOX 30650  LANSING, MICHIGAN 48909
www.michigan.gov  (517) 335-1980

Sincerely,
Holly K. Austin
Holly Austin, Licensing Consultant
MDHHS\Division of Child Welfare Licensing
Suite 200
121 Franklin Street SE
Grand Rapids, MI 49507
(269) 330-7082
enclosure
2

DIVISION OF CHILD WELFARE LICENSING

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
1.) The facility is in compliance with all applicable rules and statutes except for the
following:
R 400.12327 Special evaluation.
(1) An agency shall do all of the following when anyone
in the agency receives information that relates to
possible noncompliance with any foster home rule:
(a) Submit a special investigation record to the
department’s licensing authority within 5 working
days in the manner prescribed by the department.
One of three special evaluation reports reviewed indicated that the required
document was not provided to the licensing authority within 5 days of the allegation
intake.
R 400.12326 Borrowed home.
(1) Before placing a child in a foster home certified by
another agency or tribe, the agency shall have a
record containing all of the following documents:
(a) Prior approval from the certifying agency
(b)Documentation that the foster parent is willing to
accept the child
(c) A copy of the initial evaluation with written
endorsement by the borrowing agency that the
evaluation is acceptable
(f) Documentation that the foster parent has received
orientation to the policies of the borrowing agency
(g) a copy of the foster parent/agency agreement
signed by the foster parent and the borrowing agency
(h) A copy of the current license application and
licensing transaction record.
One of three borrowed bed files reviewed did not contain the required documents
dated prior to the placement.
R 400.12418 Development of service plans.
(2) An agency shall complete written service plans for each
child and parent or parents, as follows:
(a) Within 30 calendar days from removal from the home.
(b) Within 120 calendar days after the initial removal and at
least once every 90 calendar days thereafter
4

One of three open foster case files reviewed contained an Initial Service Plan that
was not completed within 30 days of removal from the home.
This is a repeat violation cited in the following:
Renewal Inspection Report dated 5/22/2018, CAP approved on 6/15/2018
Interim Inspection Report dated 5/30/2019, CAP approved on 6/28/2019
One of three open foster case files reviewed contained an Updated Service Plan that
was not completed timely.
This is a repeat violation cited in the following:
Renewal Inspection Report dated 5/22/2018, CAP approved on 6/15/2018
Interim Inspection Report dated 5/30/2019, CAP approved on 6/28/2019
R 400.12421 Visitation and parenting time.
(b)An agency social service worker shall visit the
foster child and the foster parent in the foster
parent’s home at least once every month.
One of three open foster care case files reviewed was missing documentation of
worker visit to the child in the foster home for the month of September.
This is a repeat violation cited as FOM 722-6H in the following:
Renewal Inspection Report dated 5/22/2018, CAP approved on 6/15/2018
Interim Inspection Report dated 5/30/2019, CAP approved on 6/28/2019
R 400.12510 Independent living contract.
(2) The agreement shall be signed and dated by the
youth and the social service worker. The contract
shall be reviewed and updated at least once every 90
calendar days and a copy provided to the youth.
One of one independent living file reviewed did not contain an updated contract.
2.) Any violation listed in section 1 is also an ISEP violation. Please note that there are
additional ISEP requirements that may not be included in section 1. The facility is in
compliance will all additional ISEP requirements.
3.) Any violation listed in section 1 is also a DHHS Contract violation. Please note that
there are additional DHHS Contract/Policy requirements that may not be included in
section 1. The facility is in compliance will all additional DHHS Contract/Policy
requirements except for the following:
5

FOM 722.03 Placement exception request (PER)
PER must be completed when required and completed
quarterly.
• Siblings placed apart
One of three open foster care case files reviewed did not contain an updated PER
regarding a sibling split.
This is a repeat violation cited in the following:
Renewal Inspection Report dated 5/22/2018, CAP approved on 6/15/2018
Interim Inspection Report dated 5/30/2019, CAP approved on 6/28/2019
FOM 801 Medical Passports
An updated medical passport is provided to:
• Legal parents, if the child is a temporary court ward.
Quarterly.
At reunification.
• The child’s foster care provider:
At or prior to each placement.
Quarterly.
Medical Passport Receipt Documentation
Receipt of the medical passport by the required parties is
documented in MiSACWIS by uploading the signed and
dated signature page into the Health Profile section.
Two of three open foster care case files reviewed did not contain medical passports
that were updated and provided, as required.
This is a repeat violation cited as ISEP 6.49 in the following:
Renewal Inspection Report dated 5/22/2018, CAP approved on 6/15/2018
Interim Inspection Report dated 5/30/2019, CAP approved on 6/28/2019
IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The facility was offered technical assistance in the following areas:
The foster care worker was provided guidance to add a statement to monthly
contacts with independent living youth that the youth is adhering to the contract
requirements.
The foster care supervisor was provided technical assistance about the service plan
FTM requirements as one file contained an FTM that was completed at least 30
days prior to the report due date; however, the report was completed late creating a
larger gap of time between the service plan development meeting and the actual
6

service plan. Discussion was held regarding keeping track of these timeframes if
reports are not completed timely.
V. CONSULTATION
No consultation was requested or required.
VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
There were no incidents of substantiated child abuse and/or neglect during this
licensing period.
There were two incidents of substantiated corporal punishment during this licensing
period. These investigations were reviewed, and no concerns were noted.
The agency has submitted no acceptable corrective action plans not related to
maltreatment during this licensing period.
The staff members interviewed reported that there have been significant changes to
the program over the past year and this, combined with a lack of staff turnover,
contributed to an increased ability to maintain compliance with rules and policy. This
was evidenced by the significant reduction in violations present in the files I
reviewed.
VII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules and/or MSA requirements and/or contract/policy. Upon
receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it is recommended that the facility will
be issued a renewal of their regular license.
Holly K. Austin
April 22, 2020
________________________________________
Holly Austin Date
Licensing Consultant
Approved By:
April 27, 2020
________________________________________
Claudia Triestram Date
Area Manager
